result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:50 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joe Thomas Brown in court.  Attorney David E. Celebre in court for Joe Thomas Brown. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Celebre is requesting an adjournment as he has put in a request for any and all video recordings at facility where the alleged incident occurred. Social worker from facility appears with DE today and advises the Court that the facility does not have any video recordings. Based on that response Attorney Celebre is requesting this matter be set for trial.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial rescheduled on the Court's motion, Court unavailable on 8/19/22. Judicial Pretrial rescheduled September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Parties notified by email.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

The petition is Granted. Repayment at the rate of $50 per month commencing 07/01/22.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  JEC, Amy B, Joshua P except for incidental.

119M   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Plea of Not Guilty entered by the Court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am. $2000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). mi
